opt.value: Aan de zorg van het Rijk toevertrouwd

record-definition.docs:
These are the properties that can be used for the class of edm:ProvidedCHO. This means that they are the attributes of the original cultural heritage object (CHO) itself, not the digital representation of it. E.g. attributes of the Mona Lisa, not the digitised image of the painting. Note that the greyed out properties will not be used in the first implementation so any values provided for them will not be used.
The spatial or temporal topic of the CHO. Use the more precise dcterms:spatial or dcterms:temporal properties if the data will support it. One of dc:coverage or dc:subject or dc:type or dcterms:spatial must be provided.
literal or ref
min 0, max unbounded
For the creator of the CHO. If possible supply the identifier of the creator from an authority source.
literal or ref
min 0, max unbounded
Use for a significant date in the life of the CHO. Consider the sub‐properties of dcterms:created or dcterms:issued
literal or ref
min 0, max unbounded
A description of the CHO. Either dc:description or dc:title must be provided
literal or ref
min 0, max unbounded
Use for the format of a born digital cultural heritage objects or for other terms applied to the CHO
literal or ref
min 0, max unbounded
An identifier of the original CHO.
literal
min 0, max unbounded
The language of text CHOs and also for other types of CHO if there is a language aspect. Mandatory for TEXT objects, strongly recommended for other object types with a language element.
literal
min 0, max unbounded
The name of the publisher of the CHO. If possible supply the identifier of the publisher from an authority source.
literal or ref
min 0, max unbounded
The name or identifier of a related resource, generally used for other related CHOs. Cf edm:isRelatedT
literal or ref
min 0, max unbounded
Use to give the name of the rights holder of the CHO if possible or for more general rights information. Note the difference between this property and the use of the controlled edm:rights property which relates to the digital objects (see WebResource and Aggregation tables).
literal or ref
min 0, max unbounded
The source of the original CHO. This property should no longer be used for the name of the content holder: for this, see edm:dataProvider in the ore:Aggregation table belo
literal or ref
min 0, max unbounded
The subject of the CHO. One of dc:subject or dc:coverage or dc:type or dcterms:spatial must be provided
literal or ref
min 0, max unbounded
The title of the CHO. Either dc:title or dc:description must be provided.
literal
min 0, max unbounded
The nature or genre of the CHO. Ideally the term(s) will be taken from a controlled vocabulary. One of dc:type or dc:subject or dc:coverage or dcterms:spatial must be provided
literal or ref
min 0, max unbounded
Any alternative title of the CHO including abbreviations or translations.
literal
min 0, max unbounded
An established standard to which the CHO conforms.
literal or ref
min 0, max unbounded
The date of creation of the CHO.
literal or ref
min 0, max unbounded
The size or duration of the CHO.
literal or ref
min 0, max unbounded
A resource related to the CHO that is substantially the same as the CHO but in another format.
literal or ref
min 0, max unbounded
A resource that is included either physically or logically in the CHO.
literal or ref
min 0, max unbounded
Another resource that is a version, edition or adaptation of the CHO demonstrating substantive changes in content rather than format.
literal or ref
min 0, max unbounded
Another resource that is substantially the same as the CHO but in another format.
literal or ref
min 0, max unbounded
A resource in which the CHO is physically or logically included. This property can be used for objects that are part of a hierarchy and will be used to support an appropriate display in the portal. For that purpose it will be necessary to supply an identifier as the value.
literal or ref
min 0, max unbounded
Another resource that references, cites or otherwise points to the CHO
literal or ref
min 0, max unbounded
Another resource that supplants , displaces, or supersedes the CHO.
literal or ref
min 0, max unbounded
Another related resource that requires the CHO to support its function, delivery or coherence
literal or ref
min 0, max unbounded
Date of formal issuance or publication of the CHO.
literal or ref
min 0, max unbounded
Another resource of which the CHO is a version, edition or adaptation, demonstrating substantive changes in content rather than format.
literal or rel
min 0, max unbounded
The material or physical carrier of the CHO.
literal or ref
min 0, max unbounded
A statement of changes in ownership and custody of the CHO since its creation. Significant for authenticity, integrity and interpretation.
literal or ref
min 0, max unbounded
Other resources referenced, cited or otherwise pointed to by the CHO.
literal or ref
min 0, max unbounded
A related resource that is supplanted, displaced, or superseded by the CHO.
literal or ref
min 0, max unbounded
Another resource that is required by the described resource to support its function, delivery or coherence.
literal or ref
min 0, max unbounded
Spatial characteristics of the CHO. i.e. what the CHO represents or depicts in terms of space (e.g. a location, co‐ordinate or place). Either dcterms:spatial or dc:type or dc:subject or dc:coverage must be provided
literal or ref
min 0, max unbounded
sA list of sub‐units of the CHO.
literal
min 0, max unbounded
Temporal characteristics of the CHO. i.e. what the CHO is about or depicts in terms of time (e.g. a period, date or date range.)
literal or ref
min 0, max unbounded
The provided object is one of the types accepted by Europeana and will govern which facet it appears under in the portal ‐ TEXT, VIDEO, SOUND, IMAGE, (3D after January 2012)
literal
min 1, max 1
literal
min 0, max unbounded
The geographic location whose boundaries presently include the CHO. If the name of a repository, building, site, or other entity is used then it should include an indication of its geographic location
ref
min 0, max 1
The identifier of an agent, a place, a time period or any other identifiable entity that the CHO may have “met” in its life.
ref
min 0, max unbounded
The identifier of a concept, or a word or phrase from a controlled vocabulary (thesaurus etc) giving the type of the CHO. E.g. Painting from the AAT thesaurus. This property can be seen as a super‐property of e.g. dc:format or dc:type to support “What” questions
ref or litera
min 0, max unbounded
The identifier of another resource that is incorporated in the described CHO. E.g. the movie “A Clockwork Orange” incorporates Rossini’s La Gazza Ladra” in its soundtrack
ref
min 0, max unbounded
The identifier of another resource from which the described CHO has been derived. E.g. the identifier of Moby Dick when the Italian translation is the described CHO
ref
min 0, max unbounded
The identifier of the preceding object where both objects are part of the same overall resource. Use this for objects that are part of a hierarchy or sequence to ensure correct display in the portal
ref
min 0, max 1
The identifier or name of a concept or other resource to which the described CHO is related. E.g. Moby Dick is related to XIX Century literature. Cf dc:relation.
ref or literal
min 0, max unbounded
The identifier of another object of which the described CHO is a representation. E.g. the identifier of the statue when the CHO being described is a painting of that statue
ref
min 0, max 1
The identifier of another resource to which the described CHO is similar
ref
min 0, max unbounded
The identifier of a resource to which the described CHO is a successor. E.g. issue 53 of “Le Temps” isSuccessorOf issue 52.
ref
min 0, max unbounded
If the CHO described is of type edm:PhysicalThing it may realize an information object. E.g. a copy of the Gutenberg publication realizes the Bible
ref
min 0, max unbounded
The identifier of an event at which the described object was present. E.g. the Stone of Scone was present at the coronation of King James I of England
ref
min 0, max unbounded
These are the properties that can be used for the class of edm:WebResource. This means that they are attributes of the digital representation of the provided cultural heritage object, not the cultural heritage object itself. There may be more than one edm:WebResource for each edm:ProvidedCHO and they will be associated via the ore:Aggregation using edm:isShownBy, edm:isShownAt, edm:hasView or edm:object. Each web resource provided should have its own set of properties."
Use for an account or description of this digital representation.
literal or ref
min 0, max unbounded
Use for the name of the rights holder of this digital representation if possible or for more general rights information. Note the difference between this property and the use of the mandatory, controlled edm:rights property below
literal or ref
min 0, max unbounded
A related resource from which this web resource is derived in whole or in part. This property should no longer be used for the name of the content holder: for this, see edm:dataProvider in the ore:Aggregation table below.
literal or ref
min 0, max unbounded
The size or duration of the web resourc
literal or ref
min 0, max unbounded
Date of formal issuance or publication of the web resource
literal
min 0, max unbounded
An established standard to which the web resource conforms.
literal or ref
min 0, max unbounded
Another resource that is substantially the same as the web resource but in another format
literal or ref
min 0, max unbounded
The value in this element will indicate the usage and access rights that apply to this digital representation. For the first implementation of EDM only the rights associated with the ore:Aggregation class will be implemented. Later implementations will be able to use the edm:rights associated with individual WebResources so it is strongly recommended that a value is supplied for this property for each instance of a WebResource. See also edm:rights in the ore:Aggregation table
ref
min 0, max
A resource that is included either physically or logically in the web resource
literal or ref
min 0, max unbounded
Where one CHO has several web resources, shown by multiple instances of the edm:hasView property on the ore:Aggregation, then this property can be used to show the sequence of the objects
ref
min 0, max
ore:Aggregation
These are the properties that can be used for the class of ore:Aggregation. This means that they are attributes that apply to the whole set of related resources about one particular provided CHO. For each ore:Aggregation a set of these properties should be provided.
This property exists in principle only as it is stated through edm:aggregatedCHO and edm:hasView statement
ref
min 0, max unbounded
The identifier of the source object e.g. the Mona Lisa itself. This could be a full linked open data URI or an internal identifier
ref
min 1, max 1
The name or identifier of the data provider of the object (i.e. the organisation providing data to an aggregator). Identifiers will not be available until Europeana has implemented its Organisation profile
literal or ref
min 1, max 1
The URL of a web resource which is a digital representation of the CHO. This may be the source object itself in the case of a born digital cultural heritage object. edm:hasView should only be used where there are several views of the CHO and one (or both) of the mandatory edm:isShownAt or edm:isShownBy properties have already been used. It is for cases where one CHO has several views of the same object. (e.g. a shoe and a detail of the label of the shoe)
ref
min 0, max unbounded
The URL of a web view of the object. Either edm:isShownAt or edm:isShownBy is mandatory. For the rights that will apply to previews please see edm:rights below
ref
min 0, max 1
The URL of a web view of the object in full information context. Either edm:isShownAt or edm:isShownBy is mandatory. For the rights that will apply to previews please see edm:rights below
ref
min 0, max 1
The URL of a representation of the CHO which will be used for generating previews for use in the Europeana portal. This may be the same URL as edm:isShownBy. See Europeana Portal Image Guidelines (http://version1.europeana.eu/web/guest/technical‐requirements/) for information regarding the specifications of previews
ref
min 0, max 1
The name or identifier of the provider of the object (i.e. the organisation providing data directly to Europeana). Identifiers will not be available until Europeana has implemented its Organisation profile
literal or ref
min 1, max
Ideally this should be applied to the edm:WebResource or the edm:ProvidedCHO. It is included here for the conversion of data from ESE where it is not known which object the rights apply t
literal
min 0, max unbounded
This is a mandatory property and the value given here should be the rights statement that applies to the digital representation at the URL given in edm:object or edm:isShownAt/By. The value should be taken from one of those listed in the Europeana Rights Guidelines (http://version1.europeana.eu/web/guest/technical‐requirements/) The rights statement given in this property will also apply to the previews used in the portal and will be the source of: * the entry in the Rights facet in the portal * the license badge that appears under the preview on the result page
Where there are several web resources attached to one edm:ProvidedCHO the rights statement given here will be regarded as the “reference” value for all the web resources so a suitable value should be chosen if the rights statements vary between different resources. In future implementations it is hoped to handle rights statements for separate web resources associated with one CHO separately.
ref
min 1, max 1
Ideally this should be applied to the edm:WebResource or the edm:ProvidedCHO. It is only included here for the conversion of data from ESE where it is not known which object the data applies to
literal
min 0, max unbounded
The class edm:Agent comprises people, either individually or in groups, who have the potential to perform intentional actions for which they can be held responsible. Please refer to the EDM Definition 5.2.2 for a fuller definition of the EDM properties
The identifier of an event at which the agent was present.
ref
min 0, max unbounded
The identifier of another entity which the agent has “met” in a broad sense
ref
min 0, max unbounded
The identifier of other entities, particularly other agents, with whom the agent is related in a generic sense
ref
min 0, max unbounded
The preferred form of the name of the agent.
literal
min 0, max 1 per lang tag
Alternative forms of the name of the agent
literal
min 0, max unbounded
A note about the agent e.g. biographical note
literal
min 0, max unbounded
Used for non‐standard forms of the name, such as misspellings, usually in text‐based search functions
literal
min 0, max unbounded
The URI of an agent.
ref
min 0, max unbounded
The name of the agent as a simple textual string
literal
min 0, max unbounded
A significant date associated with the Agent.
ref
min 0, max unbounded
An identifier of the agent.
ref
min 0, max unbounded
The date the agent (person) was born.
literal
min 0, max 1
The date the agent (person) died.
literal
min 0, max 1
The date on which the agent (corporate body) was established or founded
literal
min 0, max 1
The date on which the agent (corporate body) was terminated or dissolved
literal
min 0, max 1
The gender with which the agent identifies.
literal
min 0, max 1
The profession or occupation in which the agent works or has worked
literal or ref
min 0, max unbounded
Information pertaining to the life or history of the agent.
literal
min 0, max unbounded
The date the agent was born/established.
literal
min 0, max
The date the agent died/terminated.
literal
min 0, max
The latitude of a spatial thing (decimal degrees).

The longitude of a spatial thing (decimal degrees.

min 0, max 1
The altitude of a spatial thing (decimal metres above the reference

A comma separated representation of a latitude, longitude co‐ordinate
literal

The preferred form of the name of the place.
literal

literal

Information relating to the place.
literal

Used for non‐standard forms of the name, such as misspellings, usually in text‐based search functions
literal
min 0, max unbounded
identifier of a place that is part of the place being described.
ref
min 0, max unbounded
identifier of a place that the described place is part of.
ref

ref

The identifier of a broader concept in the same thesaurus or controlled vocabulary.

Should the input text have both an introductory text and main body of text, map the introduction to abm:introduction and the main body of text to dc:description. Note that for ESE you will need to ensure the abm:introduction is mapped to DC:description before providing it to Europeana.
Optional
Structural classification - additional to the information that can be mapped to dc:source and dc:subject
Optional
Unique identifier (URI) of the creator
Optional
Select from the predetermined list, relevant for Kultur-og Naturreise prosjekt: Eg. Archeology, Animals, Plant, Place names. Art, Industrial Heritage, Social history. Categorization can be applied to a mapping of a Virtual Collection of Digitalt Fortalt data. This will be “Facetable”.
Optional
A person that is the subject of the described resource, eg. Persons described in documents, persons depicted in photos, paintings and statues/busts, etc
Optional
Same as Europeana:dataprovider
Optional
Date resource was digitised
Optional
Mandatory if you have lat/long coordinates
The abm:latLong field is the combined lat/long fields - used by the Solr GeoSearch. Format the coordinates in this field: lat,long
Optional
Optional
Optional
o be given as a text string, if possible according to a Syntax Encoding Scheme for addresses (yet to be specified), or the syntax encoding scheme DCMI Point (http://dublincore.org/documents/dcmi-point/) for spatial points
Optional
Recommended best practice is to use country names conforming to ISO 3166, like [europeana:country]. Note: This property has to do with the topical coverage of the described resource, whereas [Europeana:country] denotes the country of the provider.
Optional
(Fykesnavn) To be given as a text string, if possible according to a Syntax Encoding Scheme for counties (yet to be specified) - names conforming to an authorised list of counties or the syntax encoding scheme DCMI Point (http://dublincore.org/documents/dcmi-point/) for spatial points
Optional
(Fylkesnummer) numbers conforming to an authorised list of counties or the syntax encoding scheme DCMI Point (http://dublincore.org/documents/dcmi-point/) for spatial points
Optional
Gårdsnavn : To be given as a text string, if possible according to a Syntax Encoding Scheme for landed properties (yet to be specified) - name conforming to the authorised registry of landed properties or the syntax encoding scheme DCMI Point (http://dublincore.org/documents/dcmi-point/) for spatial points EXAMPLE: “Hellerud”
Optional
Gårdsnummer: conforming to the authorised registry of landed properties or the syntax encoding scheme DCMI Point (http://dublincore.org/documents/dcmi-point/) for spatial points EXAMPLE: “314”
Optional
Bruksnavn: conforming to the authorised registry of landed properties or the syntax encoding scheme DCMI Point (http://dublincore.org/documents/dcmi-point/) for spatial points EXAMPLE: “Solbakken”
Optional
Bruksnummer: EXAMPLE: ”013”
Optional
(Kommune) To be given as a text string, if possible according to a Syntax Encoding Scheme for municipalities (yet to be specified),
Optional
(Kommunenummer) numbers conforming to an authorised list of counties or the syntax encoding scheme DCMI Point (http://dublincore.org/documents/dcmi-point/) for spatial points
Optional
To be given as a text string, if possible according to a Syntax Encoding Scheme for municipalities (yet to be specified), including names conforming to an authorised list of named places or the syntax encoding scheme DCMI Point for spatial points. EXAMPLE: Rosenhoff, Sinsen
Optional
